title: no method named `port_part` found for type `&modhttp::Uri` in the current scope
body:
I bumped my dependencies in `Cargo.toml` to

```
actix = "0.7.9"
actix-web = "0.7.16"
```

and observed this build failure with Rust 1.31:

```
# cargo build --release
   Compiling actix-web v0.7.16
error[E0599]: no method named `port_part` found for type `&modhttp::Uri` in the current scope
   --> /home/at/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/actix-web-0.7.16/src/client/connector.rs:945:24
    |
945 |         let port = uri.port_part().map(|port| port.as_u16()).unwrap_or_else(|| proto.port());
    |                        ^^^^^^^^^

error[E0599]: no method named `port_part` found for type `modhttp::Uri` in the current scope
   --> /home/at/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/actix-web-0.7.16/src/client/request.rs:635:49
    |
635 |                         let _ = match parts.uri.port_part().map(|port| port.as_u16()) {
    |                                                 ^^^^^^^^^

error[E0599]: no method named `port_part` found for type `&modhttp::Uri` in the current scope
  --> /home/at/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/actix-web-0.7.16/src/middleware/csrf.rs:79:47
   |
79 |     match (uri.scheme_part(), uri.host(), uri.port_part().map(|port| port.as_u16())) {
   |                                               ^^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to 3 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: Could not compile `actix-web`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

It built without error after I removed my `Cargo.lock`, suggesting a missing version requirement in some dependency.

@Arnavion posted some details in https://github.com/actix/actix-web/pull/614#issuecomment-447276354, but I figured I'd file an issue for it.
